msContents.summary: A list of names of persons from Syron kome, since many of the persons listed here are known from other texts from that village. The many correction show that this is merely a preparatory work for an intended list.

msItemStruct.note: Archive of Petaus, son of Petaus, komogrammateus of Ptolemais Hormou

condition.ab: The equally shaped and regularly occuring holes at the left edge of the papyrus show that the papyrus sustained damaged while it was still folded.

handDesc.p: Written in a quick and somewhat careless cursive. The marking "x" occurs frequently in the left margin of the text, especially on the recto but also in a few instances on the verso. (TC) The text on the papyrus is also marred by a large number of corretions. Many lines are wiped out or crossed over, and many of them are encircled in bow-shaped brackets. At one occasion a name has been encircled by a surrounding line, although the scribe sofar has placed the correct name between the lines. There are also many examples of correction of single letters, where the new letter was simply written on top of the old one; this, of course, makes it difficult to estabklish the original text.

origin.origPlace: Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
